Very challenging. Not like today's games where you can complete in a day. This game makes you think and, frankly, scares the hell out of you. The Half life franchise and Duke Nukem 3D are probably the best games produced. Game inventors would do well to learn from these games.

经久不衰的好游戏，拿到现在来玩依然碾压某些“大厂游戏”

This game has aged poorly, Firstly the control is floaty and freeman bounces off objects way too frequently too ever have any precise movement especially on narrow ledges. Secondly the ladders are garbage there's no real way to tell if you have actually grabbed the ladder until you move which then 2 things will happen you die from falling or take a retarded amount of damage falling or you actually climb the ladder. Third is the weapon roster which 99% are useless once you have the magnum (damage) and MP5/M4 (workhorse) other than those the weapons get out classed by these 2 or are just gimmick weapons that will only get you killed. Lastly the game has really nice set pieces but that's really all it has Half-Life now today has no substance the enemies are sponges the game has terrible pacing and the roster of enemies is VERY small, Once you hit Surface Tension you've pretty much seen all the game has to offer, because after that is the sections leading up to what EVERY half-life fan says is the worst part of the game "ZEN". I know that half-life pioneered set pieces and storytelling in games, but there are other games that have done the same AND kept the game pacing and story engaging. Pick it up if its on sale but I don't see why this is STILL heralded as TOP PC gaming.

I've always wanted to be an unhinged, unspeaking, geonocidal psycopath with no regard for the consequences of my own actions, leaving a path of complete destruction in my wake.

This game let me do that.

[h1]经典永不过时！[/h1]
这是一部年龄比我还大的游戏。在小时候玩cs1.6时就曾经误打开附带的半条命，熟悉的λ界面。重温了这部当年的最佳作品后，我只能说半条命确实是划时代的作品。即使在2021年的今天，这部1998年的游戏的游戏性依然让人惊讶。
[h1]完整清晰的剧情[/h1]
作为一部线性发展的FPS类游戏，剧情无疑是线性发展的推动剂。“半条命”受限于时代，不能像当今各种相似游戏把剧情明明白白地讲给玩家们听。但是通过有限的人物对话和不难懂的故事，玩家在游玩过程中也能看明白剧情。这在当时是十分了不起的。
[h1]巧妙的关卡设计，很高的游戏性[/h1]
关卡设计可以看出来V社是真的下了功夫去做了。在线性的路线上，关卡的不同增高了游玩性。跑酷和战斗关卡相互穿插，相映成趣。而且其中有不少关卡的设计都让人眼前一亮：坐车找路，导弹空袭，初入传送还有最后进入异域的部分。玩的时候，我真的一直在想：真亏他们当时能做出这么多变好玩的关卡啊！
[h1]较为完善的战斗设计[/h1]
战斗方面当然是游戏的大头，“半条命”这点做得没有让人失望。武器方面，总共近战武器1+手枪2+步枪霰弹枪弓箭3+特殊武器4+地雷手雷4=14种，有几个武器还特别有意思。怪物方面，小到猎头蟹大到最后的boss，各种奇形怪状的异形都有。再加以优秀的地形设计，让玩家能享受在和军队以及异形对战的快感之中。
[h1]恰到好处的游戏难度[/h1]
我开的是中等难度，玩起来也是稍有挑战性的。各个关卡的敌人设计恰到好处，你不能一路莽冲，不然对面的锁头怪会把你头都打烂；也不能一味避战，敌人会逐步压制你的位置。最好的玩法无疑是peek，打起来那叫一个爽。同时，随时存档的设定也让游戏难度降低许多，不会让你像魂类游戏那样走重复的路。资源管理也是要注意的，除了大战前的补给，如果你不注意弹药，最后可能是只能拿着撬棍上的。（个人打boss时弹药差点不够用）
[h1]一些不可避免的缺点[/h1]
时代久远，老游戏难免有些问题。最明显的就是闪退bug了，进游戏要开兼容性而且不能切输入法（因为当时还没有这玩意儿呢）否则会闪退；游戏中也有很多bug，不过用读档也能规避。画面也是比较老的了，模型比较粗糙而且穿模也见怪不怪，没玩过cs1.6的可能不太能接受。还有没有字幕，而且这棒读配音多少有点出戏hhh
另外游戏里提示部分实在太少了，很容易卡关，不知道路该怎么走。经常要看攻略才整清楚原来这地方还有个暗道，原来这里要这样操作。。。（激光破墙那里我是真的自己想了半天没想出来）
除去因为年代久远技术限制的缺点，这款游戏真的完美无瑕。不愧是当时的划时代作品，它的出现无疑对后来甚至如今类似的FPS剧情作都有深远影响，说一句万物起源完全不过分。即使在今天，我也能玩得津津有味~

I wasn't born when Half-Life came out. I didn't experience the hype surrounding this game or how it changed the industry but two weeks ago I decided that it was time for me to play this legendary masterpiece.
And... yes I can DEFINITELY see why this was such a big deal. And for the first five hours of my playthrough I really had a lot of fun. So yeah, I think that this game deserves the hype and yes it is one of the most important game ever made. It's weird because I love this game. I love what this game has done to the gaming industry. But at the same time I think that the mechanics have aged very well. The story is still really good(I googled it:)) but the mechanics aren't. I was expecting that. I mean if the mechanics of an over 20 year old game would still hold up today there would be something seriously wrong with the modern standards for games. Because of this I don't blame this game for not holding up. In a lot of ways it's still great. The weapon and enemy variety is still great but the gunplay and the movement, oh god the movement, have aged very poorly. It's sad because these two are the things the ruin the whole experience. Everything else is still fine. Even the graphics are not too bad.
So in conclusion: I don't think that you should buy Half-Life in 2021. I've heard that the remake Black Mesa ist very good, so go play that game while still appreciating what this game has done for games.

Going back to a 1998 game can be challenging. There’s no eye candy in Half-Life, but it has something most modern titles lack. Valve’s original hit has passion and original intent.
Half-Life is a first-person shooter that thinks outside the box. It mixes science fiction components with spine chiller and endurance awfulness for an entrancing tale about a puppet believing in his own freedom. 

You play as an experimental scientist, Gordon Freeman. The situation is the puzzling, underground Black Mesa research center. Furthermore, the story is about you, getting away from the office, when crap hits the fan. 
Under New Mexico's desert, Black Mesa is overseeing research with problematic morals. You're not a huge piece of it, however; you're simply a traveler. 
The game begins with Gordon Freeman awakening on a train cart. The truck traversed the lab while foreboding music swirls all around. Voices from the speakers invite you to the exploration offices, which you get to see for around five minutes. 
This fantastic arrangement then, at that point, inclines when Gordon Freeman takes part in a risky trial. An "mishap" opens up an entry to a different universe, permitting outsiders to slither into Black Mesa. 
You, as Gordon Freeman, must escape to the surface.
The brilliance of Half-Life is its ongoing interaction, and I can't discuss the interactivity without further growing the story. Both go in hand with each other. 
The game occurs during 18 episode, each bringing new interactivity mechanics, riddles, weapons, and difficulties. 
There will never be a dull for a second or a monotonous fragment. The interactivity continues developing and hopping between elements of horror, science fiction, and all out action. 
The game's visuals, albeit obsolete, were progressive when. It runs on the GoldSRC engine. Two or three years after its introduction, it developed into Source, which runs every one of Valve's games until 2013's DOTA. That incorporates several Counter Strikes games, the Left 4 Dead establishment, Portal 2, Team Fortress, Team Fortress 2, and so forth

There is no need for reviews for this game, you will always find someone talking about half life. Moreover counter strike games are just developed mods for this game, such is its greatness.
